text: Excellenct food. Very Friendly staff.  Very clean, both the kitchen and dining area. Kitchen is also open style to The dining area. The atmosphere is a relaxed feel. Mellow. Nicely put together. I will definitely be back many more times in the future and highly recommend it.
This place is delicious! I Love the bowls. The jasmine rice is perfect, Veggies are tasty and the chicken is on point!

If you have never been here, come now! This place is amazing!! Delicious food, classy atmosphere, big portions, great price, excellent service.
Staff was so nice and very attentive. We ordered the spring salad; the dressing is so delicious. The spicy garlic shrimp bowl (server said it wasn't very spicy and a popular item, he was right, zesty and delicious!) and the combo fried noodle bowl. More than enough food for 2 people, but we were excited to try.
Very nice place, but the food is just ok. We had a chicken bowl and it was way too salty and way to much sauce. Won't be coming back.

I had the fried chicken bowl with curry. It was simple but I really enjoyed it. Chicken was very fresh and crispy without feeling greasy or too heavy. The veggies were steamed crisp. I think the people who are disappointed are expecting something different. The food is simple but sometimes that's not so bad if the quality is there. I will return for the Chicken with Curry for sure. 
Very friendly positive vibe. Generous with the sauces and sides.
What a great restaurant! The food was delicious, fresh and prepared with with very little oil. Definitely a healthy alternative, full of great flavor. You won't be disappointed.

I thought it was just basic chinese food. Not too flavorful. Even the springrolls were just very bland. The dumplings were too flourey with a tiny bit of filling. They say they are asian fusion but I see none of that in their food, Its more chinese that you get in every chinese restaurant. Nothing to brag about. I wouldnt waste my money there.

Placed an order for pickup, and either they filled it incorrectly or their sauces just don't have much flavor. The combo bowl (pork, beef, shrimp) is sufficiently fresh but I opted for spicy garlic sauce and it didn't taste spicy or garlicky, and seemed to be a regular light teri glaze instead. The shrimp and veggies were fresh, which is a plus. The $2 upcharge for brown rice is annoying, but slightly offset by their "2 free egg rolls with bowl purchase" offer online. I guess I expected it to be a bit better.

I think the food is probably the freshest and healthiest food you will get from a fast food establishment! It is so delish and tastey. Everything is made in house and is amazing! I have ordered pick up and delivery and they are very quick. Both experiences have been wonderful. Our entire salon is just I love with this place. The owner and all the other staff are super friendly and gracious. I will be eating at this place all the time.
Super clean, great menu choice, great price, and insanely helpful staff! Not to mention the food is great.

1st visit here. Stumbled on it because I wanted tempura. I ordered my tempura shrimp and a small side of rice. I am very picky at times. I am giving a 5 stars because when I walked in I was immediately greeted and seated. Right away they asked for my drink order and brought it. The menu was pretty simple and clear but not exactly the combinations I was looking for. The server made a suggestion and didn't make me feel like I was being difficult.  They checked on me a few times and even brought me sauce to go with my plain rice. I love the service and the food was also fresh and perfectly cooked. But with the awesome service the food can be mediocre and I would return. Thank you bowltique for a breath of fresh service!  Until next time...

Staff greets you upon arrival. They are very nice attentive and friendly. Then owner or manager was there too checking if everything was great. I like their concept of delivering good healthy food. Nice decor and dish presentation. They have also oxtail soup and boba drinks now added in the menu. I have not seen a kids menu but maybe they are working on it. Very kind of them giving my kiddo a complimentary sample of their delicious mango pudding I believe it was. Thanks again and see you again next time!

Very yummy & affordable. We have a local fave ramen place but may switch to this one instead.  We tried combo fried rice and the combo ramen. Both super flavorful! Will def be back and tell others. Oh and although its a lil hole in the wall and not very busy, the customer service is excellent. Everyone working there cares that you truly enjoy your food and dining experience.
Omg, so good! I got the chicken and shrimp ramen, it was perfect. Simple yet so flavorful. Exactly what I wanted.

Nice place for a quick lunch! 

The inside is nice and clean, classic and modern decor. Very attentive service, drinks were constantly re-filled and dirty plates were quickly picked up.

The Bowl Tique Signature Salad is so good! The dressing is flavorful but light, nice mix of veggies and they serve shredded chicken! Salads usually come with chunks of chicken breast so I really like that this place uses shredded chicken, a nice change and easier to eat!

The Signature Fried Rice is awesome! Also came with shredded chicken, they used egg whites, love the little pine nuts in the rice. Very flavorful but light, a healthy alternative compared to other fried rice which are oily and heavy. 

The Katsu Chicken is HUGE! So crispy and juicy, definitely big enough to share between two or three people. The Pan Fried noodles tasted as good as it smelled! I usually hate rice noodles but the flavors were so good I did not care! I think you can choose different types of noodles with each dish also, nice variety and options, something for everyone! 

Great place for a quick lunch or even a meal with the family, decent pricing and portion.

Came in for a quick lunch. This place is a true hidden gem. Located on Durango and flamingo same plaza as Albertsons. This place is hip and modern and very clean. Friendly staff. Was greeted by a gentleman named chad. Nice cool guy very knowledgable about the menu. Came here with a buddy he ordered the combination ramen, and I got the pork tenderloin ramen with egg. The broth was amazing. Not so heavy like all the other ramen spots. Also got gyoza as an appetizer, yes they do either pan fried or steam. Definitely recommend.

Chicken thigh with spicy garlic sauce tasted very bland. Very little sauce and couldn't taste the garlic.
Combo ramen soup lol.... I'm trying not to be mean here but plain old boiling water has more flavor. I see outstanding reviews here so I must have ordered the crappy stuff. I'll probably go back to try the fried rice and if impressed, I'll bump up my score to a 2/3 or something but from what we had.... crap...

Every time my fianc√© and I come here, we're greeted with friendly smiles and great food. I usually order whatever the server recommends and so far I have loved everything. Pork ramen, beef ramen, beef fried rice, potstickers, and green tea ice cream- so tasty! 

Food aside, the service is great! The staff are always attentive and warm. Also the atmosphere itself is low-key and comfortable. I love the accent lighting and the tables too. It's a quaint space that they've definitely upgraded and made the most out of.

Looking forward to there next time we get that ramen craving because we're coming straight here!

The restaurant is very clean with a modern decor that has an open kitchen. For lunch they bring you an egg drop soup and a drink included. The quality of the food is very good, much better than the jumping rice restaurant down the street.

Very cute place.. The owner is very nice too. Good food good atmosphere

I got the oxtail soup and let me tell you.. It was amazing! Time before that I got Katsu that was good too.

I really like the atmosphere of the restaurant, everyone was friendly and helpful.  I ordered the shrimp fried rice and I have never been more pleased with a dish.  It wasn't greasy and it was very flavorful.  I will definitely be going back and using them for our next office meeting.
Had the all day combo pork tenderloin with fried rice and a coke 8.99 My wife had ox tail noodles. Everything thing was delicious. Decided to have mango pudding for desert.
Great. Asian food at. A good price.  The service. Was good they.  Try to please. The  food is made. To order , so you. Know. It is fresh.

Love this place! It's an awesome spot to get a quick lunch! The owner is the sweetest man ever always very nice and welcoming! 
Me and my boyfriend always come and get the chicken katsu bowl with brown rice!! And you can't forget the spicy garlic sauce!! That sauce is gold!!!! Love it soooo much! 5 stars for taste, price and hospitality

First time here.  At first I thought the menu was limited bc I'm so used to adding things into Ramen.  But let me say there was no need to add anything!! We ordered the combo appetizer, Oxtail soup, combo ramen and combo fried noodles.  It was all amazing and very flavorful.  HUGE portions.  They had house made hot sauce that was tasty and a perfect burn.  Homemade green tea ice cream topped it off.  The prices are soooo low too.  And I almost forgot, the service was fantastic!!

I love to eat, but I also love to save! I had a groupon for this place and needed to use it. Located on Flamingo and Durango in a shopping center. We walked in and the atmosphere was nice in here , they were playing a classical mix which I thought was different but it was pleasant. Right away I was greeted by a very friendly server who suggested the combo bowl. My friend ordered the combo ramen. The food was delicious! I ordered my bowl with a brown garlic sauce on top but I love spicy food so the waiter brought out two different sauces. I also ordered the milk boba tea which was also really good! I have no complaints of this place and I hope more people find out about this place cause it was great prices,service and food!
Place has really good bowls very simple yet delicious.  Nice hefty size. Tat stef fresh and healthy
We loved the chicken katsu!!  The stir fry chicken noodles were really good too. Ramen was a bit bland. Service was spectacular!

I find it basic! Not so much wow but it's not bad. Ordered the combo ramen and there house sesame salad which was yummy!! There menu is simple and had a good variety. Our waiter was very friendly and always checking on us. Another man checked on us too! I believe he might be the owner or manager. Good service will definitely have me return when I'm in the area!! Try it out if you want simple Japanese food!!

I came across this advertisement in the community newspaper and decided to give this place a try.  Their grand opening promotion is a buy 1, get 1 bowl special. After yelping and seeing all the good reviews, I was hopeful that this place would be better than the average teriyaki bowl places.  My verdict, if you like rice bowls, you might like this place. But for me, it did not tantalize my taste buds one bit.  From the advertisement, it looks like this place would serve more authentic Chinese cuisine.   Boy was I wrong and totally disappointed!. The spicy garlic sauce was way too sweet and spicy for my likeness and completely Americanized.  When I ordered the Combo Bowl with spicy garlic sauce,  they said it was just a little spicy.  I ordered ahead of time, but when I arrived some 20 minutes later, I still had to wait for them to finish cooking my food and there wasn't anyone else in the restaurant but me. The plus side, the food was freshly made and still hot when I got home. The staff was very friendly and nice too. But, to be honest, the chicken and beef in the bowl weren't anything special.  The shrimp was good size and it wan't overcooked.  Would I come here again?  No, because I was expecting authentic Chinese food and what I got was Americanize Chinese food.  A big let down for me.

I decided to get lunch here with my friend! I was immediately greeted by the server and she told us their famous dishes. I ended up getting the pan fried noodle and I overall give it a nice 8/10! It was pretty flavorful but I found it to be very oily. However, I do know that pan fried noodles are supposed to be oily but for some reason I found this one a little much. I do like the place and the decor! I would probably come back here for a pan fried noodle fix instead of going all the way to spring mountain for it!

Good food solid bowls well designed place nice atmospherics. Health choices and quick service.
Thanks good stuff.

Nice and new alternative choice to Teriyaki Madness. Quick to go service and clean, modern interior and decor. I got a spicy garlic chicken bowl with brown rice. The spicy garlic sauce was so tasty and had a nice kick to it! The chicken was cooked perfectly and it included a really good amount of chicken. I would suggest they have more vegetables in the bowl though and less rice. There was more rice than needed and I would have loved more than 6 or so pieces of broccoli/carrots. But I will definitely visit again!

Really good food, and very nice people too! I had the teriyaki chicken, and the sauce wasn't too sweet, or too much. My boyfriend had the fried combo rice, and that had a really good smoky flavor to it. We shared some potstickers and although they were fried, they were really good. I didn't give 5 stars because they didn't quite get our order right...added nori to the rice when my boyfriend asked for it without, and didn't really add extra broccoli to my bowl. Also, they brought us a different diner's appetizer at first...but those are small compared to the quality of the food.

Short answer: super yummy, do it. 

We stopped in for dinner while on vacation this week. The restaurant is small, maybe 8-10 tables, clean and welcoming. The owner was there and walked us through the menu, which is not massive, but well organized clear with enough choices for everyone. 

We ordered a sampler platter to start with egg rolls, tempura shrimp and pot stickers. It came with three sauces and all three were quite good. All of this was quite good. My favorite was the egg rolls: golden-brown, crunchy on the outside, soft and well done on the inside. 

For main courses, I had the beef ramen and my wife had the combo pan fried noodles. The ramen noodles were cooked perfectly, just a little tooth in the middle. The broth was rich with a well developed salty/savory flavor. The beef was absolutely amazing. It was flavorful, tender and most importantly, plentiful. 

My wife likes the pan noodles and said the shrimp was particularly good, but she thought the dish was a bit greasy for her personally. She also agreed my Ramen was great and plans to order that next time.

Take a chance if you're in the area, you will t be disappointed.

Food was decent and inexpensive for $10 I got a combination pan fried noodle plate. It was low key and quiet inside the decor was nice and the people working were extremely friendly greeting me as I walked in and left. The only downside was I felt their menu was a bit limited but it's a great place to go for lunch if you're looking for a relaxing spot to enjoy lunch on your lunch break.
Tasty! Clean, healthy and friendly located right across Club Pilates studio. Recommend the fried rice.

This place is just "ok".

The Hostess and Owner is very pleasant and does try to see to your every need. 

However, the food, which seems as it is billed as Japanese Fushion, is over priced, and mediocre at best. 

I had the House Special Salad, which for about $12 was billed as the specialty of the house, and a full meal. It was not enough food for a satisfactory meal, and the flavors were drowned out in a Seseme Dressing. I was hungry, and I did finish, but I was disappointed. 

My wife had a Noodle Dish, which she kept shoveling on my plate. It wasn't she was not hungry, she just didn't like it. 

These are very nice People, who have invested a lot of money in this place. I wish them the very best.  It is very close to where I live, and I may still return to try a "bowl" combination, but this is not on my "must try" list.

We are exploring our new area and this is a gem! Kept finding coupons (with menu) in the local weekly paper for this restaurant and decided to try this new place. Saw the good reviews on yelp as well as the menu. Yelp check-ins get 20% off.

It's a small place (a dozen tables, and a pair of tall stools at the bar), but has very elegant ambiance (one wall features brick, not the traditional full size kind, the partial but pretty type), which is unexpected, in a strip mall. The tables are dark wood (we opted for the booth). The dinnerware is dark but is in line with the overall theme. It is sit-down, but you can order takeout too.  

The food is asian fusion. We got the pan fried noodles with pork tenderloin, combination fried rice, and the ramen noodle soup (including mushrooms, green onions, seaweed, mmm) with shredded chicken. It was excellent. Everything was delicious. The cuts of meat were exceptional. The beef was angus. The pork tenderloin was lean. The shredded chicken breast was clean, no veins, no tubes, perfect. Come to think of it, there was no fat in any of the meat (high quality). Nothing was overdone or salty. Hubby, son, & I enjoyed dinner very much. Also, the portions were quite generous. We had leftovers, mmm.

There was another family eating dinner, besides us, and later, another family. The service was excellent. The owner and the entire staff was very nice and attentive. Also, the owner did something really nice, she modified the chopsticks for our son, and proceeded to show him how to eat the fried rice. 

We will be back.

I would not recommend this place.  We went there because we had purchased their Groupon.  They would not take it.  I've never bought a groupon and had a place not honor it.  I had already purchased it so to me this is total bait and switch.  They can stop offering Groupons but they should at least continue to take the ones they already sold.  I contacted Groupon and they said the business has not let them know anything at all.  

In the end the food wasn't very good and I way overpaid since they wouldn't take my Groupon.  That is just terrible business.

BOWL-TIQUE AVENUE is a great little Asian fusion joint!  The menu is diverse with several distinct styles. I was very happy to find that the julienne veggies were freshly prepped and served up crisp and crunchy with tender chicken from a blazing hot wok! Wok cooking is an art form, it isn't easy and these guys really know what they're doing. The best part is that the food wasn't too salty. You could taste every ingredient and it didn't even need the house hot sauce they make fresh daily. It's quiet, low-key, very clean and the prices were very affordable. I'll be back to this family owned and operated spot, and I'm sure it'll be great for take out as well.

This place is soo GOOD!!!!! 
The staff is soo friendly and nice which I'm usually very picky about but I'm very satisfied with their staff.
Their food reminds me of home cooked food which is soo nice since I don't really like fast food type foods

Really excellent Asian fusion fast food.  Super friendly owner.  He threw in a freebie item, and said he's expanding the menu very soon.  Meat tastes high quality and was very tender, on the Chicken Katsu and Pork Fried Noodles.  No old oil taste, everything was fresh and light.  Portion size is just right.  The sauces did seem a little watered down.  Overall a lot better than the competition in the area.

This place is amazing best customer service ever. The pan fried noodlea are the best I've ever had. I'm not normally a noodle person but they're great. The combo fried rice is amazing too. Kitty and Chef have a great staff too. The food is really good and very reasonable.
Stopped in for a quick meal before a movie because it's right by my house. Absolutely incredible my favorite spot. My daughter is in love with the Boba milk tea
Ambience GREAT! Food GREAT! Hospitality GREAT! Servers were really polite and friendly. Food was delicious and has fast service. Would definitely recommend to other people!

Delicious! Not a fan of fried rice, came here with my mom, the food is sooo good. I had the beef fried rice and the appetizers sampler. It's the best I've ever had along with great service. A well deserved  Will be coming back soon.

This place is pretty good. The atmosphere is very modern. The ramen is good but I've had better. The boba smoothies they have are good except that the boba is just one big clump and is stale. Now I order it without boba.

We were greeted before  we even walked into the restaurant. My daughter and I were reading the menu outside and the young man said come on in, here is a menu, it is hot out.. 
The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  I ordered veggie bowl teriyaki and it was fantastic. My daughter ordered chicken curry bowl and she loved it!! We will absolutely go back to this fine establishment.. Welcome to the neighborhood!!
If your looking for some grade A fried rice this is the place to go. Iv been to many different Asian restaurants and by far this place was the best. The customer service was also outstanding.

Wonderful new restaurant. Went with a picky friend who declared "best noodles I've ever had!". Places like this are now the rage in San Fransico, but I didn't get it until today. Ramen taste is fantastic. I've sampled everything on Spring Mountain and can tell you, Bowl Tique is unique.

Why can't we give 10 stars??!!  If we could, I would.  Ate here the other day for the first time.  Usually not this much "in love" after a first visit, but this place is excellent.  I had the Signature Salad.  Huge!  Ingredients are super fresh.  Dressing is awesome, not too sweet, just perfect.  This salad can easily be shared.

Hubby ordered Beef Pan Fried Noodles (and I forgot the picture!)...  It was very very very good.  Again, fresh ingredients, quality beef.

At the corner of Flamingo and Durango, tucked on the side of the Albertson's center, you might be inclined to drive right by.  But don't drive by, STOP IN and eat some awesome Asian food.  Your stomach will thank you!

Wonderful. Order orange chicken, shrimp fried rice and egg drop soup for me an my daughter to eat tonight. Delivery was fast, hot and the driver was very nice. Food was delicious and portion was a lot. We split everything and still have left overs. Will order again. thank you for a wonderful dinner!
Everything was very tasty and delicious. The staff was also awesome, excellent customer service. Try the oxtail soup.

Stopped in with a craving for chicken teriyaki. The menu is diverse and all items cooked to order super fresh. The salad with sesame dressing was so yummy. The chicken teriyaki was amazing and not too heavy. The owner and the staff were all very sweet and friendly. Definitely check this place out!!

Came here the other day for lunch with my mom. Wanted to check out a new spot for us in the neighborhood. 

We ordered a bunch of different items on the menu as we were really excited to try a new place. Shrimp tempura, chicken katsu, shrimp fried rice.

Food was okay. I didn't care for the sauces served with the shrimp tempura and chicken katsu.

Owner was really nice and our boba was on the house.

Not sure if I'll be back.
Loved the interior. Parking lot makes parking easy.

I bought a $4 off groupon so decided to use it today.  Called in my order for beef fried rice and pan fried noodles w/ pork tenderloin and hot sauce on the side. Told it would be ready in 10 min.  Got their in 12 min. and it was ready. Nicely decorated & clean place. Very friendly staff.  Elderly male cook (I think he is the owner) asked if this was my 1st visit.  Told him it's my 2nd time, came in a month earlier. He was very polite and thankful I came in.  Took food back to work.  Nice portions and very good. I will go back to try other dishes.

Just happened to catch their signage while driving past their location on W Flamingo and Durango. I noticed the "Bowl" and thought it might have been another new Pok√© "Bowl" place that is the latest food trend in Vegas and many of the western states.  Or a retro hair salon featuring vintage "Bowl" cuts that some of us sported in the 70s and 80s. Thank heaven it is actually a trendy Asian fusion restaurant and not the latter.

Bowl Tique Avenue actually have their menu on the BeyondMenu App, which I was prompted to download when I tried to look at what they offered.  Pretty high tech and it is the first business that I know that accepts Apple Pay (which Yelp has been asking about for awhile when I check in to businesses).

So while I pulled over about two giant blocks down the door and studying their menu, I decided to give them a try and also test drive the BeyondMenu App.  The ordering process is super easy, just select the item and the quantity and add it to the cart. If your total reach a certain threshold for using their online coupon on BeyondMenu, the app will prompt you for the option to use it.  Very user friendly!!!

The Chinese cooks (possibly the users) were preparing my order of their Signature Fried Rice, side orders of Grilled Chicken Thigh and Pork Tenderloin. As a young Caucasian waitstaff greeted me and handed me one of the menu, which he explained has additional coupons that is not on the BeyondMenu App.  I also learned that the very modern and clean restaurant that sports an open kitchen design just opened last Sunday, so they are pretty much off the radar being in business for just 6 days.

As I was planning to watch a few episodes of HGTV's Fixer Upper, I had my order to go, and payment was done when I placed the order through the app. But the restaurant decor is very pleasant and the dining room fairly large, that I would enjoy dining in the next time I am in the mood for a different kind of Chinese take out.

The fried rice I ordered was very large. Easily enough to share between two adults with normal appetite. The Grilled Chicken was prepared nicely and seasoned just right and would totally be the perfect lazy way to meal prep you of your proteins.  The Pork Tenderloin appeared to be prepared Chinese style with velveting of the meat, so it is tender and moist.

Overall I thought the guest service experience is very good. Immediately after handing my to go order the young waitstaff headed for the exit to open the door and wish me a pleasant evening (simple courteous gestures that are very typical of traditional Japanese restaurants), which I have yet to experience at any Chinese takeout restaurants.

The food was good, nothing fancy, but certainly hit the spot twice over. Being so close to where I live, I will likely head back and give other menu items a try (like their noodles or fried pork cutlet).

4 stars.
Got the fried rice and pan fried noodle dishes! Both were delicious. The servers are very friendly too!
